info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 4:58PM EDT until June 6 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the following county, Windham.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bellows Falls, Townshend, Wilmington, Saxtons River, Westminster, Newfane, Rockingham, Whitingham, Dover, Marlboro, Brookline, Athens, North Westminster, Jacksonville, Williamsville, Williamsville Station, Harmonyville, South Newfane, Townshend Dam and Simpsonville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
